key_insight: Stream-DiffVSR makes diffusion-based video super-resolution practical for streaming by combining a causally conditioned diffusion model with a four-step distilled denoiser and an Auto-regressive Temporal Guidance module, enabling high-quality SR using only past frames and very few denoising steps.
problem_solved: Overcomes the high latency and future-frame dependency of diffusion VSR methods, enabling online/streamable super-resolution suitable for latency-sensitive applications.
method: Causally conditioned diffusion that operates strictly on past frames to enable online/streaming processing.
Four-step distilled denoiser for fast, low-step inference while retaining diffusion-quality perceptual results.
Auto-regressive Temporal Guidance (ARTG) that injects motion-aligned cues from previous frames/outputs to preserve temporal consistency without future-frame access.
impact: Makes diffusion-quality video super-resolution feasible in real-time and edge scenarios (live streaming, video calls, on-device enhancement) by drastically reducing inference time and removing dependence on future frames, lowering the barrier to practical deployment.
visual_elements: Pipeline diagram: causal input stream → ARTG module → 4-step distilled denoiser → output, with arrows showing no future-frame access

Icons/illustrations for applications: live streaming, video call, edge device to emphasize low-latency use cases
paper_title: Stream-DiffVSR: Low-Latency Streamable Video Super-Resolution via Auto-Regressive Diffusion
paper_authors: Hau-Shiang Shiu, Chin-Yang Lin, Zhixiang Wang, Chi-Wei Hsiao, Po-Fan Yu
